meaning list.sentence translation: Rwy'n rhy brysur gyda gwaith ac ni allaf ymgymryd ag unrhyw ddyletswyddau eraill.

meaning list.sentence: Sooner or later, you’ll realize that I was right.
meaning list.sentence translation: Yn hwyr neu'n hwyrach byddwch yn sylweddoli fy mod yn iawn.

meaning list.meaning: I bychanu rhywbeth na ellir ei gyflawni (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: He said he didn’t want the job anyway, but it’s just sour grapes.
meaning list.sentence translation: Dywedodd eisoes nad oedd eisiau'r swydd, ond mae hynny'n bychanu'r hyn na chafodd.

meaning list.meaning: Sefyllfa neu berson sy'n tarfu ar y cynllun (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: The unexpected weather threw a spanner in the works for the outdoor event.
meaning list.sentence translation: Fe wnaeth tywydd annisgwyl amharu ar gynllun y digwyddiad awyr agored.

meaning list.meaning: Defnyddir os yw'r person rydych chi'n siarad amdano yn ymddangos yn sydyn (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: Speak of the devil! We were just talking about you.
meaning list.sentence translation: Peth da siaradoch chi! Roeddem yn siarad amdanoch chi.

meaning list.sentence: Her smile speaks volumes about her happiness.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae ei gwên yn dweud llawer am ei hapusrwydd.

meaning list.sentence: He spilled the beans about the surprise party.
meaning list.sentence translation: Datgelodd y gyfrinach am y parti syrpreis.

meaning list.sentence: She stood her ground despite the intense criticism.
meaning list.sentence translation: Er gwaethaf beirniadaeth lem, amddiffynnodd ei farn.

meaning list.meaning: I gadw gwerth neu bwysigrwydd dros gyfnod hir o amser (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: This classic novel has stood the test of time.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae'r nofel glasurol hon wedi sefyll prawf amser.

meaning list.sentence: She stole my thunder by announcing her promotion before I could announce mine.
meaning list.sentence translation: Denodd sylw trwy gyhoeddi ei ddyrchafiad ei hun cyn cyhoeddi fy un i.

meaning list.meaning: Peidio â dangos emosiynau, dangos dewrder (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: Even during the crisis, he kept a stiff upper lip.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hyd yn oed yn ystod yr argyfwng, ni ddangosodd ei emosiynau.

meaning list.meaning: Creu dadl ddiangen am fater dibwys (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: This argument over seating arrangements is just a storm in a teacup.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae’r drafodaeth hon am drefniant seddi yn gwbl ddiangen.

meaning list.meaning: Gwybodaeth a gymerwyd yn uniongyrchol o ffynhonnell ddibynadwy (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: I heard the news straight from the horse’s mouth.
meaning list.sentence translation: Cefais y newyddion yn uniongyrchol o ffynhonnell ddibynadwy.

meaning list.meaning: hen ffasiwn, methu addasu i'r oes (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: His style of clothing makes him look like he’s stuck in a time warp.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae'r ffordd mae'n gwisgo'n gwneud iddo edrych fel ei fod yn sownd yn yr hen ffasiwn.

meaning list.sentence: He had to swallow his pride and apologize to her.
meaning list.sentence translation: Roedd yn rhaid iddo lyncu ei falchder ac ymddiheuro iddi.

meaning list.sentence: She has a sweet tooth and loves desserts.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae ganddo ddant melys ac mae'n caru melysion yn fawr iawn.

word: take each day as it comes
phonetic american: teɪk iːtʃ deɪ æz ɪt kʌmz
phonetic british: teɪk iːtʃ deɪ æz ɪt kʌmz

meaning list.meaning: Byw o ddydd i ddydd heb feddwl gormod am y dyfodol (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: Life is unpredictable, so I just take each day as it comes.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae bywyd yn anrhagweladwy, felly rwy'n ei fyw o ddydd i ddydd.

word: take with a grain (or pinch) of salt
phonetic american: teɪk wɪð ə ɡreɪn əv sɔːlt
phonetic british: teɪk wɪð ə pɪnʧ əv sɒlt

meaning list.sentence: Take what you read on the internet with a grain of salt.
meaning list.sentence translation: Dylech gymryd yr hyn rydych chi'n ei ddarllen ar y rhyngrwyd gyda gronyn o halen.

meaning list.meaning: Profi effeithiau negyddol eich ymddygiad eich hun (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: When he got ignored by his team, he had a taste of his own medicine.
meaning list.sentence translation: Pan gafodd ei anwybyddu gan ei dîm, dioddefodd effaith ei weithredoedd ei hun.

meaning list.sentence: She always gets extra privileges because she’s the teacher’s pet.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae bob amser yn cael breintiau ychwanegol oherwydd ef yw anifail anwes yr athro.

meaning list.sentence: He hit the big time with his new book.
meaning list.sentence translation: Cafodd lwyddiant mawr gyda'i lyfr newydd.

meaning list.sentence: The moment of truth came when the test results were revealed.
meaning list.sentence translation: Pan gyhoeddwyd canlyniadau'r profion, daeth y foment i wynebu'r ffeithiau.

meaning list.sentence: I wanted to apply for that job, but the ship has sailed.
meaning list.sentence translation: Roeddwn i eisiau gwneud cais am y swydd honno, ond aeth y cyfle heibio.

meaning list.meaning: Mae'r amser iawn ar gyfer rhywbeth wedi dod (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: The time is ripe to start your own business.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae'r amser wedi dod i ddechrau eich busnes eich hun.

meaning list.meaning: i feddwl yn gyflym ac yn effeithiol (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: He’s great at thinking on his feet during meetings.
meaning list.sentence translation: Da iawn am feddwl yn gyflym ac yn effeithiol mewn cyfarfodydd.

meaning list.meaning: Y dyddiau hyn, yn y cyfnod modern (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: In this day and age, technology is essential for communication.
meaning list.sentence translation: Y dyddiau hyn, mae technoleg yn hanfodol ar gyfer cyfathrebu.

meaning list.sentence: She was tickled pink when she received the surprise gift.
meaning list.sentence translation: Roedd yn hapus iawn pan dderbyniodd yr anrheg syrpreis.

meaning list.sentence: They’re planning to tie the knot next spring.
meaning list.sentence translation: Maen nhw'n bwriadu priodi y gwanwyn nesaf.

word: time after time (time and time again)

meaning list.sentence: Time after time, he proved that he could be trusted.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae wedi profi ei hun yn ddibynadwy dro ar ôl tro.

meaning list.sentence: Time flies when you’re having fun.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae amser yn mynd heibio'n gyflym pan fyddwch chi'n cael hwyl.

meaning list.sentence: After years in the same job, it’s time for a change.
meaning list.sentence translation: Ar ôl blynyddoedd yn yr un swydd, mae'n bryd newid.

word: time heals all wounds (or time is a great healer)

meaning list.sentence: Don’t worry; time heals all wounds.
meaning list.sentence translation: Peidiwch â phoeni; Mae amser yn gwella popeth.

meaning list.sentence: Let’s not waste time; time is money.
meaning list.sentence translation: Gadewch i ni beidio â gwastraffu amser; Mae amser yn werthfawr.

meaning list.sentence: Time is of the essence, so we need to act quickly.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae amser yn hanfodol, felly mae'n rhaid i ni weithredu'n gyflym.

meaning list.sentence: We had the time of our lives on our vacation.
meaning list.sentence translation: Cawsom yr amser gorau o'n bywydau ar wyliau.

meaning list.sentence: Now that he’s retired, he has time on his hands.
meaning list.sentence translation: Nawr ei fod wedi ymddeol, mae ganddo ddigon o amser.

meaning list.meaning: Methu siarad oherwydd cyffro neu embaras (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: He was tongue-tied during the interview.
meaning list.sentence translation: Ni allai siarad yn ystod y cyfweliad oherwydd cyffro.

word: too many chiefs and not enough Indians
phonetic american: tuː ˈmɛni tʃiːfs ənd nɑːt ɪˈnʌf ˈɪndiənz
phonetic british: tuː ˈmɛni tʃiːfs ənd nɒt ɪˈnʌf ˈɪndiənz

meaning list.meaning: Gormod o arweinwyr ond dim digon o weithwyr (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: The project failed because there were too many chiefs and not enough Indians.
meaning list.sentence translation: Methodd y prosiect oherwydd bod gormod o arweinwyr ond dim digon o weithwyr.

word: too much (free) time on one's hands
phonetic american: tuː mʌtʃ taɪm ɑn wʌnz hændz
phonetic british: tuː mʌtʃ taɪm ɒn wʌnz hændz

meaning list.meaning: Cael llawer o amser rhydd a'i wastraffu (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: He started spreading rumors because he has too much time on his hands.
meaning list.sentence translation: Gan fod ganddo lawer o amser rhydd, dechreuodd ledaenu clecs.

meaning list.sentence: He’s the top banana in the company.
meaning list.sentence translation: Ef yw arweinydd y cwmni.

meaning list.meaning: Y person mwyaf pwerus neu lwyddiannus (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: After winning the competition, he became the top dog in his field.
meaning list.sentence translation: Ar ôl ennill y gystadleuaeth, fe ddaeth y person cryfaf yn ei faes.

meaning list.meaning: Person cryf sy'n gallu delio â sefyllfaoedd anodd (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: She’s a tough cookie; she never gives up.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae'n berson cryf sy'n gallu delio â sefyllfaoedd anodd; Nid yw byth yn rhoi'r gorau iddi.

meaning list.meaning: Gwybodaeth neu ddulliau arbennig a ddefnyddir mewn swydd (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: He learned the tricks of the trade from his mentor.
meaning list.sentence translation: Dysgodd gymhlethdodau'r proffesiwn gan ei fentor.

meaning list.meaning: Yn dangos gwir gymeriad neu fwriadau rhywun (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: She showed her true colours when she refused to help.
meaning list.sentence translation: Dangosodd ei wir liwiau pan wrthododd helpu.

word: turn back the hands of time
phonetic american: tɜːrn bæk ðə hændz əv taɪm
phonetic british: tɜːn bæk ðə hændz əv taɪm

meaning list.meaning: I ddychwelyd i'r gorffennol neu droi amser yn ôl (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: If I could turn back the hands of time, I’d make a different decision.
meaning list.sentence translation: Pe gallwn droi amser yn ôl, byddwn wedi gwneud penderfyniad gwahanol.

meaning list.sentence: He never went to college but learned everything from the university of life.
meaning list.sentence translation: Nid aeth i'r brifysgol, ond dysgodd bopeth o fywyd.

meaning list.meaning: Rhywbeth na fydd byth yn digwydd (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: You can wait until hell freezes over, but I won’t change my mind.
meaning list.sentence translation: Gallwch chi aros am byth ond ni fyddaf yn newid fy meddwl.

meaning list.meaning: rhywbeth yn mynd i wastraff neu fethu (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: All our hard work went up in smoke when the project was canceled.
meaning list.sentence translation: Aeth ein holl waith caled i lawr y draen pan gafodd y prosiect ei ganslo.

meaning list.meaning: aros am gyfle, cael eich paratoi (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: She’s waiting in the wings for a chance to prove herself.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae'n aros am gyfle i brofi ei hun.

meaning list.sentence: He walked out on his family when things got tough.
meaning list.sentence translation: Pan aeth pethau'n anodd, gadawodd ei deulu.

meaning list.sentence: We’re wasting time discussing irrelevant issues.
meaning list.sentence translation: Rydym yn gwastraffu amser yn trafod pynciau amherthnasol.

meaning list.meaning: System neu grŵp sy'n rhedeg yn esmwyth (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: The team works like a well-oiled machine.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae'r tîm yn gweithio fel system sy'n rhedeg yn esmwyth.

meaning list.sentence: We had a whale of a time at the amusement park.
meaning list.sentence translation: Cawsom amser gwych yn y parc difyrion.

meaning list.meaning: Bod yn welw iawn rhag ofn neu salwch (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: He turned white as a sheet when he heard the news.
meaning list.sentence translation: Trodd yn welw pan glywodd y newyddion.

meaning list.meaning: gweithiwr swyddfa, person sy'n gwneud gwaith meddwl (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: White-collar jobs are becoming more common in urban areas.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae swyddi coler wen yn dod yn fwy cyffredin mewn ardaloedd trefol.

meaning list.meaning: Rhywbeth sy'n costio gormod ond sy'n ddiwerth (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: The stadium turned out to be a white elephant for the city.
meaning list.sentence translation: Trodd y stadiwm yn fuddsoddiad drud ond diwerth i'r ddinas.

meaning list.meaning: Celwydd diniwed neu â bwriad da (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: She told a white lie to avoid hurting his feelings.
meaning list.sentence translation: Dywedodd gelwydd bach i osgoi brifo ei theimladau.

meaning list.sentence: The company tried to whitewash the scandal.
meaning list.sentence translation: Ceisiodd y cwmni guddio'r sgandal.

meaning list.sentence: When they throw a party, they go the whole nine yards with decorations and food.
meaning list.sentence translation: Pan fyddan nhw'n cynnal parti, maen nhw'n mynd allan gydag addurniadau a bwyd.

meaning list.sentence: I’ll be at your party with bells on!
meaning list.sentence translation: Byddaf yn dod i'ch parti gyda chyffro mawr!

meaning list.meaning: Gwobr neu deitl a roddir i'r person sy'n dod olaf (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: They were awarded the wooden spoon for finishing last in the league.
meaning list.sentence translation: Cawsant y wobr llwy bren am fod yr olaf yn y gynghrair.

meaning list.sentence: This new cleaning product works like a charm.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae'r cynnyrch glanhau newydd hwn yn gweithio'n berffaith.

meaning list.meaning: Fyddwn i byth yn gwneud neu mewn sefyllfa (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: I wouldn’t be caught dead wearing that outfit.
meaning list.sentence translation: Fyddwn i byth yn gwisgo'r wisg honno.

meaning list.meaning: Dro ar ôl tro, flwyddyn ar ôl blwyddyn, am flynyddoedd (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: They visit the same beach year in, year out.
meaning list.sentence translation: Maent yn ymweld â'r un traeth bob blwyddyn.

meaning list.sentence: He’s too yellow-bellied to confront his boss.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae'n ormod o llwfrgi i wynebu ei fos.

word: you can't teach an old dog new tricks
phonetic american: juː kænt tiːʧ ən oʊld dɔːɡ nuː trɪks
phonetic british: juː kɑːnt tiːʧ ən əʊld dɒɡ njuː trɪks

meaning list.meaning: Mae'n anodd newid rhywun gyda hen arferion (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: He refuses to learn how to use a smartphone; you can’t teach an old dog new tricks.
meaning list.sentence translation: Mae'n gwrthod dysgu sut i ddefnyddio ffôn clyfar; Mae'n anodd newid hen arferion.

word: your guess is as good as mine
phonetic american: jʊr gɛs ɪz æz ɡʊd æz maɪn
phonetic british: jɔːr gɛs ɪz æz ɡʊd æz maɪn

meaning list.meaning: Dydw i ddim yn gwybod chwaith, efallai bod ein dau ddyfaliad yr un mor gywir (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: Why the train is late? Your guess is as good as mine.
meaning list.sentence translation: Pam roedd y trên yn hwyr? Dydw i ddim yn gwybod chwaith.
